required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SUTENT® In The First Line Treatment Of Renal Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-Interventional Study With SUTENT® In The First Line Treatment Of Renal Cell Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
This non-interventional study includes patients with advanced and/or metastatic renal cell carcinoma who are treated with SUTENT and who did not receive any other systemic therapy before. The aim of the trial is to increase knowledge about quality of life, safety, efficacy and tolerability under conditions of routine use of Sutent. The individual observation period of each patient will be
1 year.

detailed_description.textblock: The Statistical Analysis Plan provides detailed specification of the analysis

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Categorical Best Overall Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of Treatment up through 12 Months or Early Discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: Best overall reponse based on investigator's disease status assessment. Complete response(CR)=disappearance of all target lesions.Partial Response(PR)=≥30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of lesions taking as reference baseline sum longest dimensions.Progressive disease(PD)=≥20% increase in sum of longest dimensions of lesions taking as a reference smallest sum of longest dimensions since treatment start or appearance of ≥1 new lesions. Stable disease(SD)=neither shrinkage for PR or increase for PD taking as reference smallest sum of longest dimensions since treatment start.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Objective Response
primary_outcome.description: Objective response (CR or PR) based on investigator's overall objective tumor assessment at final visit according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a ≥30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Start of Treatment up through 12 Months or Early Discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: TTP = time from date of first dose to date of first recording of PD. Participants who did not have a recorded PD at any of the visits or at Overall Objective Tumor Assessment at 12 months were treated as censored at the date of the last available follow up for disease response/tumor assessment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
primary_outcome.description: ECOG performance status measured on 6 point scale to assess participant's performance status. 0=Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease activities without restriction; 1=Restricted in physically strenuous activity, ambulatory and able to carry out light or sedentary work; 2=Ambulatory (>50% of waking hours), capable of all self care, unable to carry out any work activities; 3=Capable of only limited self care, confined to bed/chair >50% of waking hours; 4=Completely disabled, cannot carry on any self care, totally confined to bed/chair; 5=Dead. 0=Best status, 5=Worst status

primary_outcome.measure: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30) Scores
primary_outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30: 5 functional scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), a global health status/quality of life (QoL) scale, 3 symptom scales (nausea and vomiting, pain, fatigue) and 6 single items (dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea and financial difficulties). All scales and single-item measures range=0 to 100. High score for a functional scale=high/healthy level of functioning. High score for global health status/QoL=high QoL. High score for symptom scale/single item=high level of symptomatology/problems

intervention.description: SUNIKA - A Non-Interventional Study With SUTENT® In The First Line Treatment Of Renal Cell Carcinoma

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated by office-based oncologists, office-based urologists specialized in oncology or hospital-based oncologist/urologists

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- First-line treatment in patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any previous systemic therapy of renal cell carcinoma except for adjuvant treatment

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 448 subjects were enrolled. Subjects were eligible for treatment analysis if complete dosing data were available. Of the total 448 subjects enrolled, 421 were eligible for treatment analysis and were recorded as treated. Three subjects who were included in analysis had missing demographic data.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib malate (Sutent) was administered and dosed as stipulated in the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and was used solely in accordance with the medical and therapeutic needs. The recommended dose of Sutent was 50 mg once daily, administered orally over 4 weeks, followed by a rest period of 2 weeks (4/2 regimen). One treatment cycle = 6 weeks.

participants_list.participants: Subjects with complete dosing information were recorded as 'Treated'

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Categorical Best Overall Response
outcome.description: Best overall reponse based on investigator's disease status assessment. Complete response(CR)=disappearance of all target lesions.Partial Response(PR)=≥30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of lesions taking as reference baseline sum longest dimensions.Progressive disease(PD)=≥20% increase in sum of longest dimensions of lesions taking as a reference smallest sum of longest dimensions since treatment start or appearance of ≥1 new lesions. Stable disease(SD)=neither shrinkage for PR or increase for PD taking as reference smallest sum of longest dimensions since treatment start.
outcome.time_frame: Start of Treatment up through 12 Months or Early Discontinuation
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) = All participants who had taken at least 1 dose of study medication and had a post baseline efficacy measurement

measure.description: Best overall reponse based on investigator's disease status assessment. Complete response(CR)=disappearance of all target lesions.Partial Response(PR)=≥30% decrease in sum of longest dimensions of lesions taking as reference baseline sum longest dimensions.Progressive disease(PD)=≥20% increase in sum of longest dimensions of lesions taking as a reference smallest sum of longest dimensions since treatment start or appearance of ≥1 new lesions. Stable disease(SD)=neither shrinkage for PR or increase for PD taking as reference smallest sum of longest dimensions since treatment start.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) = All participants who had taken at least 1 dose of study medication and had a post baseline efficacy measurement

analysis.groups_desc: Objective Response Rate (ORR) = Percentage of participants with best overall response of CR or PR
analysis.estimate_desc: Exact method based on binomial distribution

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Objective response (CR or PR) based on investigator's overall objective tumor assessment at final visit according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. PR was defined as a ≥30% decrease in the sum of the longest dimensions of the target lesions taking as a reference the baseline sum longest dimensions.

measure.description: Objective response (CR or PR) based on investigator's overall objective tumor assessment at final visit according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). CR was defined as disappearance of all target lesions. outcome.title: Time to Progression (TTP)
outcome.description: TTP = time from date of first dose to date of first recording of PD. Participants who did not have a recorded PD at any of the visits or at Overall Objective Tumor Assessment at 12 months were treated as censored at the date of the last available follow up for disease response/tumor assessment.
outcome.time_frame: Start of Treatment up through 12 Months or Early Discontinuation
outcome.population: FAS. Number of participants with progression = 162; Number of participants censored = 190

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib malate (Sutent) was administered and dosed as stipulated in the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and was used solely in accordance with the medical and therapeutic needs. The recommended dose of Sutent was 50 mg once daily, administered orally over 4 weeks, followed by a rest period of 2 weeks (4/2 regimen). One treatment cycle = 6 weeks.

measure.title: Time to Progression (TTP)
measure.description: TTP = time from date of first dose to date of first recording of PD. Participants who did not have a recorded PD at any of the visits or at Overall Objective Tumor Assessment at 12 months were treated as censored at the date of the last available follow up for disease response/tumor assessment.
measure.population: FAS. Number of participants with progression = 162; Number of participants censored = 190

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
outcome.description: ECOG performance status measured on 6 point scale to assess participant's performance status. 0=Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease activities without restriction; 1=Restricted in physically strenuous activity, ambulatory and able to carry out light or sedentary work; 2=Ambulatory (>50% of waking hours), capable of all self care, unable to carry out any work activities; 3=Capable of only limited self care, confined to bed/chair >50% of waking hours; 4=Completely disabled, cannot carry on any self care, totally confined to bed/chair; 5=Dead. 0=Best status, 5=Worst status
outcome.population: FAS. ECOG performance status data was not reported for 24, 32, 96, 174, and 174 participants at baseline, 3, 6, 9, and 12 months, respectively.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib malate (Sutent) was administered and dosed as stipulated in the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and was used solely in accordance with the medical and therapeutic needs. The recommended dose of Sutent was 50 mg once daily, administered orally over 4 weeks, followed by a rest period of 2 weeks (4/2 regimen). One treatment cycle = 6 weeks.

measure.description: ECOG performance status measured on 6 point scale to assess participant's performance status. 0=Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease activities without restriction; 1=Restricted in physically strenuous activity, ambulatory and able to carry out light or sedentary work; 2=Ambulatory (>50% of waking hours), capable of all self care, unable to carry out any work activities; 3=Capable of only limited self care, confined to bed/chair >50% of waking hours; 4=Completely disabled, cannot carry on any self care, totally confined to bed/chair; 5=Dead. 0=Best status, 5=Worst status
measure.population: FAS. ECOG performance status data was not reported for 24, 32, 96, 174, and 174 participants at baseline, 3, 6, 9, and 12 months, respectively.

outcome.title: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30) Scores
outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30: 5 functional scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), a global health status/quality of life (QoL) scale, 3 symptom scales (nausea and vomiting, pain, fatigue) and 6 single items (dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea and financial difficulties). All scales and single-item measures range=0 to 100. High score for a functional scale=high/healthy level of functioning. High score for global health status/QoL=high QoL. High score for symptom scale/single item=high level of symptomatology/problems
outcome.population: FAS. n=number of participants with EORTC scale score data available at each specified time point

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib malate (Sutent) was administered and dosed as stipulated in the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and was used solely in accordance with the medical and therapeutic needs. The recommended dose of Sutent was 50 mg once daily, administered orally over 4 weeks, followed by a rest period of 2 weeks (4/2 regimen). One treatment cycle = 6 weeks.

measure.title: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30) Scores
measure.description: EORTC QLQ-C30: 5 functional scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social), a global health status/quality of life (QoL) scale, 3 symptom scales (nausea and vomiting, pain, fatigue) and 6 single items (dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea and financial difficulties). All scales and single-item measures range=0 to 100. High score for a functional scale=high/healthy level of functioning. High score for global health status/QoL=high QoL. High score for symptom scale/single item=high level of symptomatology/problems
measure.population: FAS. n=number of participants with EORTC scale score data available at each specified time point

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Sunitinib
group.description: Sunitinib malate (Sutent) was administered and dosed as stipulated in the Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC) and was used solely in accordance with the medical and therapeutic needs. The recommended dose of Sutent was 50 mg once daily, administered orally over 4 weeks, followed by a rest period of 2 weeks (4/2 regimen). One treatment cycle = 6 weeks.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Psychotic disorder due to a general medical condition

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Owing to extent of missing data, the planned TTP analyses derived from standardized lesion measurement was not reported. An additional TTP analysis using Investigator Disease Status and Overall Objective Tumor Assessments at 12 months was reported.
